response.overview: Reaching beyond conventional portrayals of the Holocaust's legacy, ANDRÉ'S LIVES explores the tension between the collective obligations to remember and the personal need forget. Dubbed "the Jewish Schindler," Andre helped save over 7,000 from deportation to Auschwitz (almost six times as many as Schindler). He chose never to look back or tell his story, but his life takes a dramatic change when he returns to Slovakia fifty years later with his sons.
response.title: André's Lives
